wikipedia_page.main: Aiden Byrne (born 1972) is an English chef, best known as the owner of a number of establishments including The Collingwood, a bar and restaurant in West Kirby.

Throughout the run, Aikens had been the chef patron of his eponymous Chelsea restaurant. Aiden Byrne was the head chef from 2003 to 2005 before joining Danesfield House Hotel and Spa (Buckinghamshire) in July 2005. Julien Maisonneuve was the head chef of one of Tom's Kitchen iterations from 2008 to 2011 and then of the eponymous restaurant.

Head chef of The Commons Restaurant during the last "Michelin period" was Aiden Byrne. The headchefs Gerry Kirwan (1994), Michael Bolster (1995) and Leslie Malone (1996 & 1997) took care of the first period. Last chef in this period was Sébastien Masi, but he, just aged 22, could not retain the star.The emergence, development and influence of French Haute Cuisine on public dining in Dublin restaurants 1900-2000: an oral history. Thesis DIT by Máirtín Mac Con Iomaire, 2009. 3 downloadable volumes. Part 2, p. 390-391

Shortly after losing the star the restaurant ran into financial difficulties and closed down.  Dylan McGrath worked under Aiden Byrne as souschef.The emergence, development and influence of French Haute Cuisine on public dining in Dublin restaurants 1900-2000: an oral history. Thesis DIT by Máirtín Mac Con Iomaire, 2009. 3 downloadable volumes. Part 2, p. 391
